thag4.10:1.2: the teaching brings happiness when practiced well.
thag4.10:1.3: This is the benefit of practicing Dhamma:
thag4.10:1.4: one doesn’t go to a bad destination.
thag4.10:2.1: It’s not the case that Dhamma <j>and what is not Dhamma
thag4.10:2.3: What is not Dhamma leads to hell,
thag4.10:2.4: while Dhamma takes you to a good place.
thag4.10:3.1: So you should rouse up enthusiasm for the teachings;
thag4.10:3.2: such rejoicing is owing to the Holy One, the poised.
thag4.10:3.3: The disciples of the best of Holy Ones <j>are firm in the teaching;
thag4.10:3.4: those wise ones are led on, <j>headed to the very best of refuges.”
thag4.10:4.1: “The boil has been burst from its root,
thag4.10:4.2: the net of craving is eradicated.
thag4.10:4.3: He has ended transmigration, he has nothing,
thag4.10:4.4: he’s like the full moon on a bright night.”
